org.quicktionary.backend.parsers

Class XMLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.quicktionary.backend.parsers.Parser
      • org.quicktionary.backend.parsers.XMLParser

  • public class XMLParser
extends Parser
    This class implements offline XML parser. It doesn't allow custom markup defined inside file. The implementation tries to not allocate memory. That is why it is implemented as state machine. The parser has big limitation that you can only query nodes that are after current node. Furthermore, you can query data only from current node. This parser isn't designed for attribute heavy XML documents. Only ASCII characters are allowed inside element nodes. The parser isn't full implementation of XML spec. spec: http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml/

      • getTagNameId

        public int getTagNameId(String tagName)
        Get a id for tagName. The method creates new id if the tagName doesn't have a id yet.
        Parameters:
        tagName - The name of the element
        Returns:
        Unique id for the element

      • setTagNameId

        public void setTagNameId(String tagName,
                         int id)
        Give specific id for the tagName. The method allows client class to use constant values inside switch statement. If you try to give bad id or use it the method too late, then method will throw exception. You could use the method following way. final static int ELEM_TAG = 0; setTagNameId("elem", ELEM_TAG); getNextNode(); switch(getElementNameId()) { case ELEM_TAG: // do something break; default: break; }
        Parameters:
        tagName - The name of the element
        id - The id you want use

      • getTagNameId

        public int getTagNameId(CharSequence tagName)

      • getRoot

        public boolean getRoot()
        Go to the root element. The root element must be first element in the document and there should not be textNodes before it.
        Returns:
        True if the root node was found

      • getNextNode

        public boolean getNextNode()
        Get the next node. This method is just user friendlier name for parseNode.
        Returns:
        True if the node was successfully parsed

        Returns:
